Item:
Our work on "Sampling-based Reactive Synthesis for Nondeterministic Hybrid Systems" has been accepted for publication in IEEE Robotics and Automation Letters (RA-L) 2024.
2023-11-10,Anne Theurkauf successfully passed her comprehensive exam (thesis prospectus). Congrats Anne!"
Kandai Watanabe successfully passed his comprehensive exam (thesis prospectus). Congrats Kandai!
Dr. Lahijanian is invited to give a talk to The Committee on the History and Philosophy of Science (CHPS) at the University of Colorado.
Our work on "Timed Partial Order Inference Algorithm" has been accepted for presentation at AAAI Int'l Conference on Automated Planning and Scheduling (ICAPS) 2023.

Our work on "Interval Markov Decision Processes with Continuous Action-Spaces" has been accepted for presentation at ACM Int'l Conference on Hybrid Systems: Computation and Control (HSCC) 2023. [Read the preprint here!](https://arxiv.org/abs/2211.01231)

Our work on "Stochastic Robustness Interval for Motion Planning with Signal Temporal Logic" has been accepted for presentation at IEEE Int'l Conf. on Robotics and Automation (ICRA) 2023. [Read the preprint here!](https://arxiv.org/abs/2210.04813)

Our work on "Chance-Constrained Motion Planning with Event-Triggered Estimation" has been accepted for presentation at IEEE Int'l Conf. on Robotics and Automation (ICRA) 2023. [Read the preprint here!](https://arxiv.org/abs/2210.07190)

Our work on "Planning with SiMBA: Motion Planning under Uncertainty for Temporal Goals using Simplified Belief Guides" has been accepted for presentation at IEEE Int'l Conf. on Robotics and Automation (ICRA) 2023. [Read the preprint here!](https://arxiv.org/abs/2210.10202)
Ibón Gracia, welcome to the ARIA Systems Group! We are excited to have you in the team!
Roland Ilyes successfully defended his thesis. Congratulations Roland!

Our work on "Safety Guarantees for Neural Network Dynamic Systems via Stochastic Barrier Functions" has been accepted for presentation at Conference on Neural Information Processing Systems (NeurIPS) 2022. [Read the preprint here!](https://arxiv.org/abs/2206.07811)
Our work on "An Algorithm for Learning Switched Linear Dynamics from Data" has been accepted for presentation at Conference on Neural Information Processing Systems (NeurIPS) 2022.

Our work on "Automaton-Guided Control Synthesis for Signal Temporal Logic Specifications" has been accepted for presentation at IEEE Conference on Decision and Control (CDC) 2022. [Read the preprint here!](https://arxiv.org/abs/2207.03662)

Our work on "Pareto Optimal Strategies for Event Triggered Estimation" has been accepted for presentation at IEEE Conference on Decision and Control (CDC) 2022. [Read the preprint here!](http://arxiv.org/abs/2207.08971)

Our work on "Conflict-based Search for Multi-Robot Motion Planning with Kinodynamic Constraints" has been accepted for presentation at IEEE Int'l Conf. on Intelligent Robots and Systems (IROS) 2022. [Read the preprint here!](https://arxiv.org/abs/2207.00576)

Our work on "Formal Control Synthesis for Stochastic Neural Network Dynamic Models" has been accepted for publication in IEEE Control Systems Letters 2022. [Read the preprint here!](https://arxiv.org/abs/2203.05903)

Our work on "Explainable Multi-Agent Path Finding Imaging" has been accepted for presentation at Int'l Conf. on Automated Planning and Scheduling (ICAPS) 2022. [Read the preprint here!](https://arxiv.org/pdf/2202.09930.pdf)

Our work on "Shielded Deep Reinforcement Learning for Multi-Sensor Spacecraft Imaging" has been accepted for presentation at American Control Conference (ACC) 2022. [Read the preprint here!](http://mortezalahijanian.com/papers/ACC2022.pdf)

Our work on "Let's Collaborate: Regret-based Reactive Synthesis for Robotic Manipulation" has been accepted for presentation at IEEE Int'l Conf. on Robotics and Automation (ICRA) 2022. [Read the preprint here!](https://arxiv.org/pdf/2203.06861.pdf)

Our work on "Gaussian Belief Trees for Chance Constrained Asymptotically Optimal Motion Planning" has been accepted for presentation at IEEE Int'l Conference on Robotics and Automation (ICRA) 2022. [Read the preprint here!](https://arxiv.org/pdf/2202.12407.pdf)

Our work on "Online Mapping and Motion Planning under Uncertainty for Safe Navigation in Unknown Environments" has been accepted for publication in IEEE Transactions on Automation Science and Engineering (T-ASE) 2021. Well done, Eric!
Robert Reed, welcome to the ARIA Systems Group! We are excited to have you in the team!

Our work on "Synergistic Offline-Online Control Synthesis via Local Gaussian Process Regression" has been accepted for presentation at IEEE Conference on Decision and Control (CDC) 2021. [Read the preprint here!](https://arxiv.org/abs/2110.05525)
Our work on "Probabilistic Specification Learning for Planning with Safety Constraints" has been accepted for presentation at IEEE Int'l Conference on Intelligent Robots and Systems (IROS) 2021.
Karan Muvvala successfully defended his thesis. Congratulations Karan!
Our work on "Synthesis for Probabilistic Manipulation Domains" has been accepted for presentation at IEEE Int'l Conference on Robotics and Automation (ICRA) 2021.
Our work on "Explainable Multi-agent Motion Planning" has been accepted for presentation at IEEE Int'l Conference on Robotics and Automation (ICRA) 2021.

Our work on "Strategy synthesis for Unknown Dynamical Systems" has been accepted for presentation at ACM Conference on Hybrid Systems: Computation and Control (HSCC) 2021. [Read the paper here!](https://dl.acm.org/doi/abs/10.1145/3447928.3456649)
Richard Moon successfully defended his thesis. Congratulations Richard!
Akash Ratheesh Babu successfully defended his thesis. Congratulations Akash!
Our work on "LTLf Synthesis on Probabilistic Systems" has been accepted for presentation at the Int. Symposium on Games
Nicholas Renninger successfully defended his thesis. Congratulations Nick!

Our work on "Safety Verification of Unknown Dynamical Systems" has been accepted for presentation at IEEE Conference on Decision and Control (CDC) 2020. [Read the paper here](https://ieeexplore.ieee.org/abstract/document/9303814)!

Our work on "Towards Data-driven Verification of Unknown Dynamical Systems" has been accepted to the Robotics: Science and Systems Workshop for Explainable and Trustworthy Robot Decision Making for Scientific Data Collection. [See full paper here](https://openreview.net/pdf?id=pc1AU6xLol4)!

Our work on "Explainable Multi-Agent Path Finding" has been accepted to the Robotics: Science and Systems Workshop for Explainable and Trustworthy Robot Decision Making for Scientific Data Collection. [See full paper here!](https://etdm2020.github.io/abstracts/RSS_2020_ETDM_Kottinger_Explainable.pdf)

ARIA Systems Group's work on learning specifications has been featured on CEAS News. [See article here](https://www.colorado.edu/engineering/2020/02/10/beyond-mundane-lahijanians-work-safety-critical-systems-pushes-autonomy-forward)!
A paper has been accepted for publication in the IEEE Journal of Transactions on Automatic Control (TAC 2020).
A paper has been accepted for presentation in Int. Conf. on Autonomous Agents and Multiagent Systems (AAMAS 2020).
The ARIA Systems Research Group Website is live!
Franka-Robot has a new home at ARIA Systems.
